disclaimer.title: Legal Notice
disclaimer.paragraph1: The data presented on this site comes from reliable sources and is updated in real time for informational purposes.
disclaimer.paragraph2: However, this platform is independent and does not constitute an official source.
disclaimer.paragraph3: The only official and definitive results are those published by the competent electoral authorities.

hero.title: About Electa
hero.subtitle: Leading platform for electoral transparency and real-time data visualization for global elections

history.title: Our History
history.paragraph1: Electa was created from an interest in supporting democratic processes. Our aim is to help provide citizens with more transparent and accessible electoral information, with a focus on using technology to encourage democratic values.
history.paragraph2: From the start, we have sought to promote transparency and citizen participation by developing tools that aim to give voters access to reliable, up-to-date information.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.paragraph1: We seek to explore ways of providing more transparent, accessible, and timely electoral information for citizens worldwide, with the intention of encouraging participation and supporting democratic values where possible.
mission.paragraph2: Our work focuses on developing technological tools that may serve as a bridge between citizens and electoral processes, aiming to encourage transparency and foster trust in democratic systems.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.paragraph1: Our vision is to work toward becoming a recognized resource for electoral data visualization and analysis, with the aspiration of contributing to the growth of digital democracy.
vision.paragraph2: Over time, we hope to expand into additional countries and regions, exploring the possibility of creating a network that encourages electoral transparency and engagement globally.

whatwedo.title: What We Do
whatwedo.paragraph1: We work on developing and maintaining technological platforms intended for real-time electoral monitoring, aiming to provide more accessible data and insights into electoral processes.
whatwedo.paragraph2: We create interactive visualization tools designed to help users explore and interpret electoral results in a user-friendly way.

values.title: Our Values
values.subtitle: The principles that guide our work and commitment to democracy

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.description: Total commitment to transparency in all our processes and data, ensuring that information is accessible and verifiable.

participation.title: Participation
participation.description: We encourage active citizen participation in democratic processes, providing tools that empower voters.

justice.title: Justice
justice.description: We promote electoral justice through equity in access to information and equal opportunities for all citizens.

education.title: Education
education.description: We educate citizens about electoral processes and the importance of democratic participation.

integrity.title: Integrity
integrity.description: We maintain the highest standards of integrity in data handling and presentation of electoral information.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.subtitle: Do you have questions or suggestions? We'd love to hear from you
contact.success_message: Message sent successfully! We'll get back to you soon.
contact.error_message: Error sending message. Please try again.
contact.social_text: Follow us on our social networks

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about our electoral monitoring platform and how to use its features.
faq.no_results: No questions found matching your search.
faq.contact_message: If you couldn't find the answer you're looking for, feel free to contact us directly.
faq.question: question

questions.question: How do I view results for a specific region?
questions.answer: Click on any department on the map to select it. The detailed results for that region will automatically display in the Political Parties section, where you can see the vote count by candidate, percentages, and specific statistics for that area.

questions.question: How do I return to national results?
questions.answer: Use the 'Return to National Results' button that appears when you have a specific region selected. This will take you back to the general overview of the entire country.

questions.question: What does the global counter represent?
questions.answer: The global counter shows the total number of votes cast nationwide in real-time. It includes valid votes, null votes, and blank votes, providing a comprehensive overview of electoral participation.

questions.question: How does it update in real-time?
questions.answer: The counter connects to our live data feed and updates automatically as polling stations report their results. Updates occur every few seconds to ensure you have the most current information.

questions.question: What metrics does it show?
questions.answer: The counter displays total votes, null votes, blank votes, and the top candidates with their current vote counts and percentages. This gives you a quick snapshot of the electoral landscape.

questions.question: How do I open the candidate modal?
questions.answer: Click on any candidate's name or photo in the political parties section or candidate lists. The modal will open showing detailed information about that candidate.

questions.question: What information does it contain?
questions.answer: The modal shows the candidate's personal information, political experience, main proposals, current vote count, percentage, and other relevant details about their campaign and background.

questions.question: How do I navigate between candidates?
questions.answer: Use the arrow buttons in the modal to move between candidates, or close the modal and click on a different candidate's name to view their information.

questions.question: What types of charts are available?
questions.answer: We offer bar charts and pie charts showing political party performance and vote distribution. The charts update in real-time with the latest electoral data.

questions.question: How do I interpret the data in the charts?
questions.answer: Charts include clear labels and legends. Hover over sections to see exact vote values and percentages by political party.

questions.question: How do I navigate the application?
questions.answer: Use the navigation menu at the top to switch between Home, Elections, About Us, and FAQ pages. The main dashboard shows real-time results, while other pages provide additional context and information.

questions.question: Which browsers are compatible?
questions.answer: Our application works on all modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge. For the best experience, we recommend using the latest version of your browser.

questions.question: How do I report problems?
questions.answer: Use the 'Report Incident' form available in the footer to report any issues you encounter. Include details about the problem, your location, and any error messages you see.

questions.question: Is the data real-time and accurate?
questions.answer: Yes, our data comes directly from official sources and updates in real-time. However, we include a disclaimer that the data comes from third parties and we are not responsible for its accuracy.

questions.question: Can I subscribe to updates?
questions.answer: Yes, you can subscribe to receive alerts about important changes in the election results. Look for the subscription banner or use the subscription modal to sign up for notifications.

questions.question: What is actas review?
questions.answer: Actas review is a fundamental process to verify electoral transparency. It allows citizens and observers to review the tally and closing records of each polling station to detect possible irregularities or inconsistencies in the results.

questions.question: How can I access the actas for review?
questions.answer: You can access the actas through our platform in the 'Actas Review' section. The actas are automatically loaded from official sources and are organized by department, municipality, and polling station for easy searching.

questions.question: What information does each acta contain?
questions.answer: Each acta contains detailed information such as: polling station number, location, total valid votes, null votes, blank votes, results by political party, signatures of polling authorities, and observations or incidents reported during the electoral process.

questions.question: How do I report an irregularity found in an acta?
questions.answer: If you find an irregularity in an acta, you can report it using the 'Report Incident' form available on our platform. Include the polling station number, detailed description of the problem, and attach photographic evidence if possible.

questions.question: Are the actas updated in real time?
questions.answer: Yes, the actas are updated in real time as they are processed and validated by the electoral authorities. Our platform automatically synchronizes with official sources to keep the information up to date.

questions.question: Can I compare actas between different polling stations?
questions.answer: Yes, our platform allows you to compare actas between different polling stations. You can select multiple stations and see a side-by-side comparison of the results, making it easier to detect patterns or inconsistencies.

upcomingElections.title: Upcoming Elections
upcomingElections.subtitle: Global electoral calendar 2025-2026
upcomingElections.footer: Updated information on global electoral processes
upcomingElections.costaRica_what: President, two vice presidents, and 57 deputies of the Legislative Assembly.
upcomingElections.costaRica_system: Popular vote; needs at least 40% to be elected in the first round, otherwise a runoff between the top two.
upcomingElections.costaRica_summary: High party fragmentation, high electoral indecision (‚âà 66% without a defined candidate), key issues: insecurity, employment, inequality.
upcomingElections.southKorea_system: Plurality (whoever gets the most votes wins)
upcomingElections.southKorea_summary: Early election after the impeachment of President Yoon Suk Yeol. One of the few interrupted presidential elections in Korea.
upcomingElections.ecuador_what: President, vice president, and 151 seats in the National Assembly.
upcomingElections.ecuador_system: Two rounds. To win in the first: >50% or ‚â•40% and 10-point lead.
upcomingElections.ecuador_summary: High turnout (~82%), close race led to a runoff, Noboa won, focused on attracting youth.
upcomingElections.malawi_system: If no candidate gets a majority, a runoff is held within 30 days.
upcomingElections.malawi_summary: Second election under the new 50+1 standard; UTM withdrawal destabilizes coalition, current coalitions are key.
upcomingElections.tanzania_summary: CCM dominates, opposition weakened; main rival disqualified for not signing a code of conduct.
upcomingElections.guineaBissau_what: President and 102 seats in the Assembly.
upcomingElections.guineaBissau_summary: Strong institutional tensions: parliament dissolved, accusations of 'institutional coup'; elections seek stable leaders without abuse of power.
upcomingElections.chile_what: President, entire Chamber of Deputies, and half the Senate.
upcomingElections.chile_system: Two rounds if no candidate achieves an absolute majority
upcomingElections.chile_summary: Critical election amid low approval of the current government; possible political reconfiguration.
